blog.name: hellyeahteensuperheroes
blog.title: Hell Yeah Teen Superheroes
blog.description: Blog devoted to apprecation of kid, teenage and YA B and C-list superheroes from Marvel and DC, who are way to often pushed in the background or killed, to make place for boring A-Listers

summary: AVENGERS #9 JASON AARON (W) DAVID MARQUEZ (A/C) Marvel Battle Lines Variant Cover by SUJIN JO MKXX VARIANT COVER BY JG JONES...
caption:
AVENGERS #9

JASON AARON (W)
DAVID MARQUEZ (A/C)
Marvel Battle Lines Variant Cover by SUJIN JO
MKXX VARIANT COVER BY JG JONES
MKXX VIRGIN VARIANT COVER BY JG JONES
WORLD WAR BELOW!
With the underwater world on the brink of war, the Avengers go aquatic to save the day, but air-breathers are no longer welcome in the undersea city of Atlantis. And Namor, the Sub-Mariner, lord of the seven seas, has a bold new plan that will change the balance of power on Earth forever.
32 PGS./Rated T+ …$3.99

When you’re so into toxic masculinity you need to coat Namor, a walking beefcake, in THE EDGE before writing him. Can this book just end?

- Admin

title: Mother Knows Best
body:
Summary: All you wanted to do was to be an Avenger, just like your dad. Was that to much to ask?

This was written for Caplan’s Disney Challenge. This is my first fic  based on a song, so forgive me if it sucks.  The song lyrics are all in italics.

My song was “Mother knows best” from Rapunzel.

Word Count: 2,470

Pairings. Tony x reader (father/ daughter) Steve x reader 

Warnings: One swear maybe, mentions of death.

As always I tag who I can! If you would be so kind to reblog, you would be my hero!

Thank you everyone! Love ya!


“You want to go outside? Why, Rapunzel!”

 Rapunzel. You hated that nickname. He had given it to you as a child. It was your favorite fairy tail, and you always pretended you were her during playtime. It was cute when you were young, you loved it. Now, it’s just a reminder that Tony will always treat you like a child.

 “Look at you, as fragile as a flower, still a little sapling, just a sprout.”  He taps your head with his palm, condescendingly before turning back to his work.

“Tony! Please, I’m not fifteen anymore, I’m an adult, and I’ve been training for years. I can’t stay in the tower on light duty anymore. I’m going out of my mind.”

 “Oh, so it’s Tony now? What happened to dad?” He stands up, taking the flashlight off of his head, tossing it to the side of his lab table.

 “Dad is overprotective, and unreasonable. Tony has fun once in awhile, and is encouraging.”

“You know why we stay up in this tower?” He questions in an almost angry tone.

 “Umm, Hydra?” His eyes shoot towards you like daggers. “Hydra this, Hydra that. It’s always about Hydra.” His jaw clenches, his anger slowly seeping to the surface. Maybe that was too far. Even so, you roll your eyes, knowing what he wants to hear. “It’s to keep me safe. I know but…”

 “That’s right, to keep you safe and sound, dear.”

 “You can’t keep me locked up in the penthouse forever. It’s not normal. Please, Tony… dad.”

 “Guess, I always knew this day was coming. Knew that soon you’d want to leave the nest.” He approaches you cautiously.

 He holds your arms, looking deep into your eyes. He was once you, and he knows what it’s like to feel the overwhelming need to prove your worth. To make a name for yourself, and to not just be the “child of a genius.”

 “Soon, but not yet.” He can’t do it. He’s not ready.

 “But.”

 “Shh! Trust me, pet.  Mother knows best.”  Mother. That was the name he gave himself when the kids at school made fun of you. I’ll be your mom and your dad, he said. When you need advice and protection, mom it is. When it’s time to hit the books and learn, well, that’s where cool dad takes over.

 “Did she? I think when she left me here, she thought I would ‘grow up’ under the great ‘Stark’ name, and have a better shot at life. Guess she didn’t realize I would just be ‘growing up’ under a staircase, hidden from the world, like a dirty secret.”

 Mother knows best

“First off, you hardly live under a staircase. Second, you need to just listen to your mother. It’s a scary world out there, which you know nothing about!”  He throws a wrench onto the table, growing frustrated at your conversation.

 “Is it? I wouldn’t know, I’m not allowed to leave the tower.”

 “Y/N, please. Just… not now, okay?” He mumbles under his breath.

Mother knows best

_________ 

“One way or another, something will go wrong. I swear, if anything were to happen to you!” Steve folds his arms as he leans against the conference room table.

 Ruffians and thugs, poison ivy, quicksand

Cannibals and snakes, the plague

“Hydra, enhanced, double crossing agents, guns, knives. It’s all out there, Y/N, just waiting to hurt you.”

 “No!  Will you just…”

 “Yes! I know, I see it every time we go out on a mission.”

 “But.”

 Also large bugs

Men with pointy teeth, and…

“Stop, no more!” Steve demands. In his head he’s begging you to stop asking. “Have you talked to Tony about this? What are his feelings, do I need to speak to him?”

 That was the last thing you wanted. They had just started speaking again after the whole division of the teams. Although, this may bring them closer, them fighting together for a common goal. You definitely didn’t want that.

 “Sure, why not, you’ll just upset me in the end, too.”

_________

 Mother’s right here

Mother will protect you

“Darling, here’s what I suggest, Skip the drama. Go out and have a movie night, gossip about… boys and such. Go check out that new restaurant everyone is talking about. Better yet, stay in with the girls, eat popcorn and snacks, give each other pedicures, or whatever it is you girls do these days. Just be safe, here. We can even hang out in the lab if you want.”

 “The girls are on a mission, because that is what ‘they do’ these days, which is where I would be if you would let me.”

 Stay with mama

Mother knows best

“You know what, fine. Go ahead, get trampled by a rhino in Wakanda with Bucky. Go ahead, get mugged and left for dead with Sam. Me? I’m just your mother, and your father, but what do I know? I only bathed, and changed, and nursed you, took you in and raised you as as my own.”

 “I am your own! Don’t try and guilt me by being all pissy. It’s not my fault you had way to many nights of unprotected sex with every floozy in the city! I didn’t ask for this life, it was thrust upon me. How can I not want to grow up and do this? All my life, I just wanted to be like my dad. Don’t you get that? I know you and grandpa…”

 “Howard.” He says shortly

 “Dad…” You tilt your head, knowing it was a sensitive subject, but if he could just see. “I know you had your differences, just like us, but didn’t you just want to be like him, do what he did…make him proud? Make him… notice you, prove to him that you had good in you too?”

 “Nothing I did was ever good enough for him.  I was never going to be as good as your boyfriend.”

 “Come on dad, that’s not fair. You can’t blame Steve for your failed relationship with him.”

 “You can’t fail at a relationship is there was never was one to begin with, and I will always blame Steve, because it’s true.”

 “This is complete crap, you know that right?”

 “You know what, go ahead and leave me, I deserve it. Let me die alone here, be my guest!”

 “Dad, you’re being really dramatic. No one is going to die, and you’re not alone.”

“When it’s too late, you’ll see, just wait. Wait until you really see what’s out there waiting for you. You think it’s easy…what we do? You think it’s a cake walk for Steve? You have no idea what you are asking of me, of us. We just want to keep you safe, don’t you get it?”


Mother knows best, Take it from your mumsy

_________

“He’s right you know? Everything he says, every reason he gives you. He’s right, and I have to agree with him. I don’t want you out there with us. It’s to dangerous. I can’t do my job, knowing you’re out there in harm’s way.”  Steve paces back and forth.

 “Are you seriously going to take his side? Jesus, it’s like I have to overly obnoxious mother hens, who won’t stop clucking beak fulls of bullshit at me. I thought you would at least be willing to hear me out, Steve.”

 “You know I will always hear you out, I’m listening.”

 “No, your not, neither of you are. You would rather me stay cooped up like an inmate than me at least try to help out. I can do some good out there. Get out, fight the good fight. I’m not asking you to bring me into the belly of the beast, but even something local would be enough. I can do this, I know I can.”

 “Y/N… No, I, I don’t think it’s a good idea.”

 “I’m doing it, with or without you, Steve. I’ll go to Fury myself. I don’t need you guys to vouch for me. I’ll do it on my own.”

 “On your own, you won’t survive.”

 “Guess that’s on your conscious, not mine.”

_________

“Sloppy, underdressed, immature, clumsy!”  Natasha yells out to the other recruits. “Please, they’ll eat you up alive.”  She scoffs as she looks up and down at a young man, who can barely maintain eye contact with her. “You at least show promise.” She takes you in from head to toe as she strolls by the line of agents.

_________

 “Gullible, naive, positively grubby, Ditzy and a bit, well, hmm, vague.”

 “Let me see that!” You rush to your father’s side, attempting to grab your case file out of his hands.

 “Plus, I believe gettin’ kinda chubby.”  He holds it off to the side, while holding your head like a bratty older brother would.

 “It does not say that!” You give him a quick jab to his ribs.

 “It says so right here, direct from Fury.”

 “It says I excell above other recruits, and with your permission, as well as a recommendation from Steve, I can go.”

“I’m just saying ‘cause I love you, that this is a horrible idea.”

 You stand in front of him, rigid and strong.  Forcing a paper his way, you make your voice heard. “Sign it.”

_________

“It hurts.”  You grit your teeth at the pain, as Steve pulls a stray bullet from your thigh.

 Mother understands

 “I know, sweetie, we’re going to get you all fixed up. No worries. Bruce, drugs!” Tony yells through the compound med bay.

Mother’s here to help you

 “What happened? Who did it?” He demands answers, looking to his teammates. “I knew it! I knew this would happen. I told you this was a bad idea, but no, you had to keep going, wouldn’t shut up for two goddamn seconds about it.”

 “Tony! Stop. It wasn’t her fault. It was an accident.” Steve tightens the bandages, holding pressure to your thigh.

 “Of course it was! There is always an accident. Someone always comes back hurt, or worse, almost dead, on every damn mission!”

 “It was a stray bullet from one of our own. New recruit, saw a situation head south, tried to help.”

 “Help with what? Putting her in the grave faster than she would have done herself?”

 “Stop yelling at him! It’s not his fault!”

 “The hell it’s not! He signed the damned form!” He throws his arm in Steve’s direction.

 “You did too!” You yell back.

 “Against my better judgment, but no more. You’re done, you’re off the team.”

 “No, that’s not fair!” You sit up quickly, the motion jarring your leg. You grimace in pain.

 “You know what kiddo, you’re right, life’s not fair. It wasn’t fair that I had a shit father growing up, it wasn’t fair that your mother dropped a kid at my doorstep, and it’s not fair that I have to deal with this shit with you right now! So, no, life’s not fair, and the sooner you get that through your thick head, the sooner…”

 The monitors around you begin to scream out, as your pulse drops, pressures tank, and your thigh begins to pulsate, blood soaking through you bandages. Steve grabs you as you start to lose consciousness, cradling you so your head doesn’t hit the table.

 “Y/N?” Tony slams his palm onto your wound, packing it with gauze, as Bruce feeds you IV meds, grabbing the defibrillator, ready to charge if needed.

 “Y/N! Stay with me, sweetie. Bruce, we’re losing a lot of blood here. Steve, take over, we need more bandages. Grab the XStat!”

 He begins to tap your face, framing your face in his hands.

 “Y/N/N, honey… please, you got to wake up. Come on Rapunzel. You can do it. I can’t lose you kid, come on. It’s just you and me, you can’t leave your old man. I need ya kiddo. You’re the only reason I get out of bed each day. Come on, fight it.” He fights back tears, fearing the worst.  

 “Her bleeding is slowing down. Her heart rate is stabilizing. Keep holding, Steve.”

 Tony watches the monitor, counting every beat of your heart, analyzing numbers, checking each stat individually. He’s so hyper focused on your vitals that he doesn’t notice you reaching for his hand.

 “Tony.” Steve calls to him and his voice seems like it’s a distant sound, barely recognizable in his head. “Tony!”

 He breaks concentration for a second, and watches Steve signal towards you. Your hand so fragile, reaching out for your father, unable to see him, but his presence known.

 “That’s my girl.”

__________

 He sat by your bed for two days, refusing to sleep, eat, speak, until he knew you were safe.

 Your face pale, your body weak. You open your eyes to a bright light above your head, an incessant beeping to the left of you, and the feel of tape ripping skin off of your hand.

 “Hi.” Is all he says, his eyes filling with tears, as he lifts your tiny hand to his lips.

 “I’m so sorry, daddy.” Tears make their way down to your cheeks, as he rubs his free hand through your hair.

 “No, I’m sorry. I didn’t mean it. Any of it. I was just…”

 “I know. It’s okay. I’m sorry I pushed you.”

 “I thought I was going to lose you. I heard the flatline, and all I could see…” He rubs his eyes, and looks up at the ceiling, trying to collect his thoughts. “I just saw you, my little girl, in her bassinet, just holding onto my pinky. So little, so fragile. My entire life…you’re all I have. You’re the only thing that I ever let in. I almost lost it all, and all I could think of, was that you were going to die, and the last thing I said to you, was that I didn’t want you. I could have never lived with myself if you…”

 “I didn’t mean to scare you.” You squeeze his hands, coughing a bit from your dry throat.

 “I know you didn’t, sweetheart.”  You watch, as another stream of tears fall from his eyes. “But hear me out, okay? All I have is one request. My beautiful, Rapunzel?”

“Yes?”

“Don’t ever ask to leave this tower again.” You both huff out a small sigh, the simplest of smiles grace both your mouths.

“Yes, mother.” You nod at him. Not willing to argue anymore, at least not today, after seeing the toll it had taken on your father.

“I love you very much, dear. Even if I don’t always show it.”

“I love you more, pops.”

“I love you most. Don’t forget it. You’ll regret it.”

I guess he was right. Well, maybe just this one time at least. After all, Mother knows best.


@prettyyoungtragedy @kazu-is-reading @glitterkunoichi @schilj79

@sunigyrl @fuckmeupsebastian @awkward-sydney @just-add-butter

@bojabee @samstuffworld @10robins  @lordemjay @lovemarvelousfics

@elishamcloughlin @quotemeow @alycu1 @redqueen1221 @tbetz0341

 @i-regret-this-already @kapsikle @caplansteverogers

 You stand in front of him, rigid and strong.  Forcing a paper his way, you make your voice heard. “Sign it.”

_________

“It hurts.”  You grit your teeth at the pain, as Steve pulls a stray bullet from your thigh.

 Mother understands

 “I know, sweetie, we’re going to get you all fixed up. No worries. Bruce, drugs!” Tony yells through the compound med bay.

Mother’s here to help you

 “What happened? Who did it?” He demands answers, looking to his teammates. “I knew it! I knew this would happen. I told you this was a bad idea, but no, you had to keep going, wouldn’t shut up for two goddamn seconds about it.”

 “Tony! Stop. It wasn’t her fault. It was an accident.” Steve tightens the bandages, holding pressure to your thigh.

 “Of course it was! There is always an accident. Someone always comes back hurt, or worse, almost dead, on every damn mission!”

 “It was a stray bullet from one of our own. New recruit, saw a situation head south, tried to help.”

 “Help with what? Putting her in the grave faster than she would have done herself?”

 “Stop yelling at him! It’s not his fault!”

 “The hell it’s not! He signed the damned form!” He throws his arm in Steve’s direction.

 “You did too!” You yell back.

 “Against my better judgment, but no more. You’re done, you’re off the team.”

 “No, that’s not fair!” You sit up quickly, the motion jarring your leg. You grimace in pain.

 “You know what kiddo, you’re right, life’s not fair. It wasn’t fair that I had a shit father growing up, it wasn’t fair that your mother dropped a kid at my doorstep, and it’s not fair that I have to deal with this shit with you right now! So, no, life’s not fair, and the sooner you get that through your thick head, the sooner…”

 The monitors around you begin to scream out, as your pulse drops, pressures tank, and your thigh begins to pulsate, blood soaking through you bandages. Steve grabs you as you start to lose consciousness, cradling you so your head doesn’t hit the table.

 “Y/N?” Tony slams his palm onto your wound, packing it with gauze, as Bruce feeds you IV meds, grabbing the defibrillator, ready to charge if needed.

 “Y/N! Stay with me, sweetie. Bruce, we’re losing a lot of blood here. Steve, take over, we need more bandages. Grab the XStat!”

 He begins to tap your face, framing your face in his hands.

 “Y/N/N, honey… please, you got to wake up. Come on Rapunzel. You can do it. I can’t lose you kid, come on. It’s just you and me, you can’t leave your old man. I need ya kiddo. You’re the only reason I get out of bed each day. Come on, fight it.” He fights back tears, fearing the worst.  

 “Her bleeding is slowing down. Her heart rate is stabilizing. Keep holding, Steve.”

 Tony watches the monitor, counting every beat of your heart, analyzing numbers, checking each stat individually. He’s so hyper focused on your vitals that he doesn’t notice you reaching for his hand.

 “Tony.” Steve calls to him and his voice seems like it’s a distant sound, barely recognizable in his head. “Tony!”

 He breaks concentration for a second, and watches Steve signal towards you. Your hand so fragile, reaching out for your father, unable to see him, but his presence known.

 “That’s my girl.”

__________

 He sat by your bed for two days, refusing to sleep, eat, speak, until he knew you were safe.

 Your face pale, your body weak. You open your eyes to a bright light above your head, an incessant beeping to the left of you, and the feel of tape ripping skin off of your hand.

 “Hi.” Is all he says, his eyes filling with tears, as he lifts your tiny hand to his lips.

 “I’m so sorry, daddy.” Tears make their way down to your cheeks, as he rubs his free hand through your hair.

 “No, I’m sorry. I didn’t mean it. Any of it. I was just…”

 “I know. It’s okay. I’m sorry I pushed you.”

 “I thought I was going to lose you. I heard the flatline, and all I could see…” He rubs his eyes, and looks up at the ceiling, trying to collect his thoughts. “I just saw you, my little girl, in her bassinet, just holding onto my pinky. So little, so fragile. My entire life…you’re all I have. You’re the only thing that I ever let in. I almost lost it all, and all I could think of, was that you were going to die, and the last thing I said to you, was that I didn’t want you. I could have never lived with myself if you…”

 “I didn’t mean to scare you.” You squeeze his hands, coughing a bit from your dry throat.

 “I know you didn’t, sweetheart.”  You watch, as another stream of tears fall from his eyes. “But hear me out, okay? All I have is one request. My beautiful, Rapunzel?”

“Yes?”

“Don’t ever ask to leave this tower again.” You both huff out a small sigh, the simplest of smiles grace both your mouths.

“Yes, mother.” You nod at him. Not willing to argue anymore, at least not today, after seeing the toll it had taken on your father.

“I love you very much, dear. Even if I don’t always show it.”

“I love you more, pops.”

“I love you most. Don’t forget it. You’ll regret it.”

I guess he was right. Well, maybe just this one time at least. After all, Mother knows best.

This was written for Caplan’s Disney Challenge. This is my first fic  based on a song, so forgive me if it sucks.  The song lyrics are all in italics.

My song was “Mother knows best” from Rapunzel.

Word Count: 2,470

Pairings. Tony x reader (father/ daughter) Steve x reader 

Warnings: One swear maybe, mentions of death.

As always I tag who I can! If you would be so kind to reblog, you would be my hero!

Thank you everyone! Love ya!


“You want to go outside? Why, Rapunzel!”

 Rapunzel. You hated that nickname. He had given it to you as a child. It was your favorite fairy tail, and you always pretended you were her during playtime. It was cute when you were young, you loved it. Now, it’s just a reminder that Tony will always treat you like a child.

“Tony! Please, I’m not fifteen anymore, I’m an adult, and I’ve been training for years. I can’t stay in the tower on light duty anymore. I’m going out of my mind.”

 “Oh, so it’s Tony now? What happened to dad?” He stands up, taking the flashlight off of his head, tossing it to the side of his lab table.

 “Dad is overprotective, and unreasonable. Tony has fun once in awhile, and is encouraging.”

[[MORE]]

“You know why we stay up in this tower?” He questions in an almost angry tone.

 “Umm, Hydra?” His eyes shoot towards you like daggers. “Hydra this, Hydra that. It’s always about Hydra.” His jaw clenches, his anger slowly seeping to the surface. Maybe that was too far. Even so, you roll your eyes, knowing what he wants to hear. “It’s to keep me safe. I know but…”

 “That’s right, to keep you safe and sound, dear.”

 “You can’t keep me locked up in the penthouse forever. It’s not normal. Please, Tony… dad.”

 “Guess, I always knew this day was coming. Knew that soon you’d want to leave the nest.” He approaches you cautiously.

 He holds your arms, looking deep into your eyes. He was once you, and he knows what it’s like to feel the overwhelming need to prove your worth. To make a name for yourself, and to not just be the “child of a genius.”

 “Soon, but not yet.” He can’t do it. He’s not ready.

 “But.”

 “Shh! Trust me, pet.  Mother knows best.”  Mother. That was the name he gave himself when the kids at school made fun of you. I’ll be your mom and your dad, he said. When you need advice and protection, mom it is. When it’s time to hit the books and learn, well, that’s where cool dad takes over.

 “Did she? I think when she left me here, she thought I would ‘grow up’ under the great ‘Stark’ name, and have a better shot at life. Guess she didn’t realize I would just be ‘growing up’ under a staircase, hidden from the world, like a dirty secret.”

 Mother knows best

“First off, you hardly live under a staircase. Second, you need to just listen to your mother. It’s a scary world out there, which you know nothing about!”  He throws a wrench onto the table, growing frustrated at your conversation.

 “Is it? I wouldn’t know, I’m not allowed to leave the tower.”

 “Y/N, please. Just… not now, okay?” He mumbles under his breath.

Mother knows best

_________ 

“One way or another, something will go wrong. I swear, if anything were to happen to you!” Steve folds his arms as he leans against the conference room table.

 Ruffians and thugs, poison ivy, quicksand

Cannibals and snakes, the plague

“Hydra, enhanced, double crossing agents, guns, knives. It’s all out there, Y/N, just waiting to hurt you.”

 “No!  Will you just…”

 “Yes! I know, I see it every time we go out on a mission.”

 “But.”

 Also large bugs

Men with pointy teeth, and…

“Stop, no more!” Steve demands. In his head he’s begging you to stop asking. “Have you talked to Tony about this? What are his feelings, do I need to speak to him?”

 That was the last thing you wanted. They had just started speaking again after the whole division of the teams. Although, this may bring them closer, them fighting together for a common goal. You definitely didn’t want that.

 “Sure, why not, you’ll just upset me in the end, too.”

_________

 Mother’s right here

Mother will protect you

“Darling, here’s what I suggest, Skip the drama. Go out and have a movie night, gossip about… boys and such. Go check out that new restaurant everyone is talking about. Better yet, stay in with the girls, eat popcorn and snacks, give each other pedicures, or whatever it is you girls do these days. Just be safe, here. We can even hang out in the lab if you want.”

 “The girls are on a mission, because that is what ‘they do’ these days, which is where I would be if you would let me.”

 Stay with mama

Mother knows best

“You know what, fine. Go ahead, get trampled by a rhino in Wakanda with Bucky. Go ahead, get mugged and left for dead with Sam. Me? I’m just your mother, and your father, but what do I know? I only bathed, and changed, and nursed you, took you in and raised you as as my own.”

 “I am your own! Don’t try and guilt me by being all pissy. It’s not my fault you had way to many nights of unprotected sex with every floozy in the city! I didn’t ask for this life, it was thrust upon me. How can I not want to grow up and do this? All my life, I just wanted to be like my dad. Don’t you get that? I know you and grandpa…”

 “Howard.” He says shortly

 “Dad…” You tilt your head, knowing it was a sensitive subject, but if he could just see. “I know you had your differences, just like us, but didn’t you just want to be like him, do what he did…make him proud? Make him… notice you, prove to him that you had good in you too?”

 “Nothing I did was ever good enough for him.  I was never going to be as good as your boyfriend.”

 “Come on dad, that’s not fair. You can’t blame Steve for your failed relationship with him.”

 “You can’t fail at a relationship is there was never was one to begin with, and I will always blame Steve, because it’s true.”

 “This is complete crap, you know that right?”

 “You know what, go ahead and leave me, I deserve it. Let me die alone here, be my guest!”

 “Dad, you’re being really dramatic. No one is going to die, and you’re not alone.”

“When it’s too late, you’ll see, just wait. Wait until you really see what’s out there waiting for you. You think it’s easy…what we do? You think it’s a cake walk for Steve? You have no idea what you are asking of me, of us. We just want to keep you safe, don’t you get it?”


Mother knows best, Take it from your mumsy

_________

“He’s right you know? Everything he says, every reason he gives you. He’s right, and I have to agree with him. I don’t want you out there with us. It’s to dangerous. I can’t do my job, knowing you’re out there in harm’s way.”  Steve paces back and forth.

 “Are you seriously going to take his side? Jesus, it’s like I have to overly obnoxious mother hens, who won’t stop clucking beak fulls of bullshit at me. I thought you would at least be willing to hear me out, Steve.”

 “You know I will always hear you out, I’m listening.”

 “No, your not, neither of you are. You would rather me stay cooped up like an inmate than me at least try to help out. I can do some good out there. Get out, fight the good fight. I’m not asking you to bring me into the belly of the beast, but even something local would be enough. I can do this, I know I can.”

 “Y/N… No, I, I don’t think it’s a good idea.”

 “I’m doing it, with or without you, Steve. I’ll go to Fury myself. I don’t need you guys to vouch for me. I’ll do it on my own.”

 “On your own, you won’t survive.”

 “Guess that’s on your conscious, not mine.”

“Sloppy, underdressed, immature, clumsy!”  Natasha yells out to the other recruits. “Please, they’ll eat you up alive.”  She scoffs as she looks up and down at a young man, who can barely maintain eye contact with her. “You at least show promise.” She takes you in from head to toe as she strolls by the line of agents.

 “Let me see that!” You rush to your father’s side, attempting to grab your case file out of his hands.

 “Plus, I believe gettin’ kinda chubby.”  He holds it off to the side, while holding your head like a bratty older brother would.

 “It does not say that!” You give him a quick jab to his ribs.

“Sloppy, underdressed, immature, clumsy!”  Natasha yells out to the other recruits. “Please, they’ll eat you up alive.”  She scoffs as she looks up and down at a young man, who can barely maintain eye contact with her. “You at least show promise.” She takes you in from head to toe as she strolls by the line of agents.

_________

 “Gullible, naive, positively grubby, Ditzy and a bit, well, hmm, vague.”

 “Let me see that!” You rush to your father’s side, attempting to grab your case file out of his hands.

 “Plus, I believe gettin’ kinda chubby.”  He holds it off to the side, while holding your head like a bratty older brother would.

 “It does not say that!” You give him a quick jab to his ribs.

 “It says so right here, direct from Fury.”

 “It says I excell above other recruits, and with your permission, as well as a recommendation from Steve, I can go.”

“I’m just saying ‘cause I love you, that this is a horrible idea.”

 You stand in front of him, rigid and strong.  Forcing a paper his way, you make your voice heard. “Sign it.”

_________

“It hurts.”  You grit your teeth at the pain, as Steve pulls a stray bullet from your thigh.

 Mother understands

 “I know, sweetie, we’re going to get you all fixed up. No worries. Bruce, drugs!” Tony yells through the compound med bay.

Mother’s here to help you

 “What happened? Who did it?” He demands answers, looking to his teammates. “I knew it! I knew this would happen. I told you this was a bad idea, but no, you had to keep going, wouldn’t shut up for two goddamn seconds about it.”

 “Tony! Stop. It wasn’t her fault. It was an accident.” Steve tightens the bandages, holding pressure to your thigh.

 “Of course it was! There is always an accident. Someone always comes back hurt, or worse, almost dead, on every damn mission!”

 “It was a stray bullet from one of our own. New recruit, saw a situation head south, tried to help.”

 “Help with what? Putting her in the grave faster than she would have done herself?”

 “Stop yelling at him! It’s not his fault!”

 “The hell it’s not! He signed the damned form!” He throws his arm in Steve’s direction.

 “You did too!” You yell back.

 “Against my better judgment, but no more. You’re done, you’re off the team.”

 “No, that’s not fair!” You sit up quickly, the motion jarring your leg. You grimace in pain.

 “You know what kiddo, you’re right, life’s not fair. It wasn’t fair that I had a shit father growing up, it wasn’t fair that your mother dropped a kid at my doorstep, and it’s not fair that I have to deal with this shit with you right now! So, no, life’s not fair, and the sooner you get that through your thick head, the sooner…”

 The monitors around you begin to scream out, as your pulse drops, pressures tank, and your thigh begins to pulsate, blood soaking through you bandages. Steve grabs you as you start to lose consciousness, cradling you so your head doesn’t hit the table.

 “Y/N?” Tony slams his palm onto your wound, packing it with gauze, as Bruce feeds you IV meds, grabbing the defibrillator, ready to charge if needed.

 “Y/N! Stay with me, sweetie. Bruce, we’re losing a lot of blood here. Steve, take over, we need more bandages. Grab the XStat!”

 He begins to tap your face, framing your face in his hands.

 “Y/N/N, honey… please, you got to wake up. Come on Rapunzel. You can do it. I can’t lose you kid, come on. It’s just you and me, you can’t leave your old man. I need ya kiddo. You’re the only reason I get out of bed each day. Come on, fight it.” He fights back tears, fearing the worst.  

 “Her bleeding is slowing down. Her heart rate is stabilizing. Keep holding, Steve.”

 Tony watches the monitor, counting every beat of your heart, analyzing numbers, checking each stat individually. He’s so hyper focused on your vitals that he doesn’t notice you reaching for his hand.

 “Tony.” Steve calls to him and his voice seems like it’s a distant sound, barely recognizable in his head. “Tony!”

 He breaks concentration for a second, and watches Steve signal towards you. Your hand so fragile, reaching out for your father, unable to see him, but his presence known.

 “That’s my girl.”

__________

 He sat by your bed for two days, refusing to sleep, eat, speak, until he knew you were safe.

 Your face pale, your body weak. You open your eyes to a bright light above your head, an incessant beeping to the left of you, and the feel of tape ripping skin off of your hand.

 “Hi.” Is all he says, his eyes filling with tears, as he lifts your tiny hand to his lips.

 “I’m so sorry, daddy.” Tears make their way down to your cheeks, as he rubs his free hand through your hair.

 “No, I’m sorry. I didn’t mean it. Any of it. I was just…”

 “I know. It’s okay. I’m sorry I pushed you.”

 “I thought I was going to lose you. I heard the flatline, and all I could see…” He rubs his eyes, and looks up at the ceiling, trying to collect his thoughts. “I just saw you, my little girl, in her bassinet, just holding onto my pinky. So little, so fragile. My entire life…you’re all I have. You’re the only thing that I ever let in. I almost lost it all, and all I could think of, was that you were going to die, and the last thing I said to you, was that I didn’t want you. I could have never lived with myself if you…”

 “I didn’t mean to scare you.” You squeeze his hands, coughing a bit from your dry throat.

 “I know you didn’t, sweetheart.”  You watch, as another stream of tears fall from his eyes. “But hear me out, okay? All I have is one request. My beautiful, Rapunzel?”

“Yes?”

“Don’t ever ask to leave this tower again.” You both huff out a small sigh, the simplest of smiles grace both your mouths.

“Yes, mother.” You nod at him. Not willing to argue anymore, at least not today, after seeing the toll it had taken on your father.

“I love you very much, dear. Even if I don’t always show it.”

“I love you more, pops.”

“I love you most. Don’t forget it. You’ll regret it.”

I guess he was right. Well, maybe just this one time at least. After all, Mother knows best.

trail.content_abstract:
Summary: All you wanted to do was to be an Avenger, just like your dad. Was that to much to ask?

This was written for Caplan’s Disney Challenge. This is my first fic  based on a song, so forgive me if it sucks.  The song lyrics are all in italics.

My song was “Mother knows best” from Rapunzel.

Word Count: 2,470

Pairings. Tony x reader (father/ daughter) Steve x reader 

Warnings: One swear maybe, mentions of death.

As always I tag who I can! If you would be so kind to reblog, you would be my hero!

Thank you everyone! Love ya!


“You want to go outside? Why, Rapunzel!”

 Rapunzel. You hated that nickname. He had given it to you as a child. It was your favorite fairy tail, and you always pretended you were her during playtime. It was cute when you were young, you loved it. Now, it’s just a reminder that Tony will always treat you like a child.

 “Look at you, as fragile as a flower, still a little sapling, just a sprout.”  He taps your head with his palm, condescendingly before turning back to his work.

“Tony! Please, I’m not fifteen anymore, I’m an adult, and I’ve been training for years. I can’t stay in the tower on light duty anymore. I’m going out of my mind.”

 “Oh, so it’s Tony now? What happened to dad?” He stands up, taking the flashlight off of his head, tossing it to the side of his lab table.

 “Dad is overprotective, and unreasonable. Tony has fun once in awhile, and is encouraging.”

summary: THANOS IS A DUMB FUCKING IDIOT.
body:
THANOS IS A DUMB FUCKING IDIOT.

and here’s why,

Thanos’ plan was to kill half the universe, thus stopping overpopulation and saving the other half form poverty, starvation and other horrible things that come with overpopulation. Which morally, was a hell hole but philosophically could work, if you did it the right way. Now Thanos killed every living thing, so he killed half the mammals, half the anphibians, half the plants, half the fungi, half the bacteria. Now if you had fifty people and fifty oranges in a room and each person needed two oranges to survive and to fix the problem you killed 25 people and took their oranges away, you would still be facing the same problem just on a lower scale. This so what Thanos did. The universe is still facing the same problems it was before. It still doesn’t have enough recourses. Thanos didn’t solve the problem, he didn’t cause it either. He just made the amount of people effected by the problem smaller.

title: Make Me [Bucky Barnes] p.2
body:
Part 1 | Part 2

Prompt:

Keep your mouth shut and we won’t get caught.


Summary:

Bucky is head over heels for Y/N and she feels the same but both are oblivious to the others feelings and when the tension because to much for the other Avengers, Sam and Wanda decide to form a plan to make Bucky jealous. With a bit of a push from Sam, Bucky may just admit his feelings for Y/N on the night of Steve’s surprise birthday party.


Warnings:

Some swearing, a bit of angst


Word count:

2,662


A/N:

hey guys this is the second part of @bucketbarneslove writing challenge! i’m super sorry that this took so long to complete and finally get up but i’ve been travelling overseas and haven’t had a lot of time to write and for some reason my tumblr keeps stuffing up so its getting kind of frustrating to post this but i’ve finally got everything done and so here’s the second part to the story. hope you guys enjoy!

“We need to get a start on things.” A gruff voice disturbs the silence of the room, waking Sam up and making you as well as the other Avengers turn their heads to Bucky who just entered the room. “He’s right.” Tony speaks up, “If we don’t start now then we won’t have things ready in time for when Cap comes home.”


Wanda and Vision pack up their board game while Tony gets FRIDAY to get the rest of the Avengers into the room.


“I call dibs on making the cake!” Natasha shouts from the hall before entering the room and coming to stand besides you as you get off the couch. Various people pipe up and chose what they’re gonna do to help out before Sam quickly cuts in, “Y/A and I will help Tash bake.” He pipes up and Natasha protests but Tony quickly cuts in, saying that it would be for the best and he doesn’t want her burning the kitchen down before the party starts.


“Okay but that implies that I can burn it down after the party.” Natasha sass’ back and Tony rolls his eyes and doesn’t respond.


Wanda and Vision leave to go blow up balloons, Peter Parker follow Tony down to the garage so they can go buy some party foods as well as chocolate and lollies and before you know it the only people left in the room are Natasha, Sam, Bucky and yourself.


An awkward silence settles across the room for a brief moment as we stare at the enormous pile of decorations that Bucky needs to put up around the compound.


Sam puts an arm around your shoulder and passes Bucky, giving him a pat on the back.


“Good luck mate.” He says as he leads you to the kitchen and you quickly send Bucky a sympathetic smile which is returned with a forced one before he casts his eyes downwards.


“Lets get started on this cake.” Natasha says and gathers all the ingredients and materials to make a vanilla cake.


“Chocolate cake is better.” Sam states, looking over my shoulder as I begin to put the cake mix in the bowl.


I gasp tip the rest of the mix into the bowl before turning around and hitting his chest.


“Ouch! What was that for?!” He explains, taken aback by your sudden change of attitude.


“Vanilla cake is the best flavour cake.” You argue, crossing your arms across your chest to prove that he won’t be able to persuade you.


Your bickering continues for a solid five minutes before Sam is chasing you around the kitchen with flour on his hands and you laugh as you dodge him and duck behind the table.


“You may be faster then me but I’m smaller.” You mumble under your breath as you quietly crawl under the table using only your knees to move forward, while both your hands are holding piles of flour.


“You’re gonna have to get up from behind that table eventually Y/N.” Sam says in a sing-song voice and you whistle to get his attention, making him look down with a puzzled look before you quickly throw one hand of flour up into his face.


He coughs as his stumbles back and makes a noise which sounds like a bird crossed between a seal. You snicker as you get out from under the table and flour falls around because Sam has dropped his pile of flower in shock. You make your way behind Sam as he is still trying to get flour off his face and out of your hair.


You throw your last pile of flour at the back of Sams head and he whips around to face you. “Oh you’re gonna regret that.” He threats, trying to sound intimidating but the smile forming on his face is a clear indicator that he doesn’t totally mean it.


You turn to run out of the kitchen but Sam lunges forward and wraps his arms around your stomach, picking you up and you let out a squeal of surprise as you feel your self being lift up into the air.


“Let me go.” You screech as you burst into a fit of giggles as he begins to tickle your stomach as he places your feet back of the floor.


“P-please stop! I’m go-gonna die!” You try to get out and he laughs at your expense. “Not until you admit that chocolate cake is better!” He sung. “Ok ok! Chocolate cake is better!” You let out reluctantly.


His fingers stop attacking your sides and he lets you slump down onto the kitchen floor as you wheeze trying to catch your breath. “You are the… worst…. person… ever.” You manage to get out between taking big gulps of air. “I know.” Sam chuckles, moving away from you and standing next to Natasha who was watching the whole scene play out in front of her with an amused expression.


“Well while you two were having your little fight over there I finished the cake and put it in the oven.” Natasha informs and your eyes drift over to the oven from your viewpoint on the floor and you could see that she did in fact have the cake in the oven.


“Ok well now that it’s done I’m gonna go.” Sam begins to walk towards the kitchen door and Natasha calls him back.


“No I don’t think so Bird Boy. You’re going to stay here and clean up this mess while I prepare the icing.” Natasha chimes and Sam begins to protest but stops the minute she shoots him a glare and instead he begins to mumbles profanities under his breath as he goes to get the vacuum.


You let out a giggle as you pick yourself up from the floor and dust off your body to make sure there is no flour on you.


“You need my help with anything Nat? Maybe with the 100 candles that you’re going to have to put on that cake?” You question and she shakes her head.


“No I’ll be ok. Go find your man Bucky and help him put up all those decorations.” Natasha winks and you let out a squeak, afraid that someone might of heard her.


“He’s not my man.” You protest weakly and she rolls her eyes.


“Maybe so but you know you want him to be.”


You ignore her comment as you exit the room. Natasha was right. You did want bucky to be “your Man” but it’s not like you would ever admit that to him though. It had taken a while for you to gain Bucky’s trust and for him to open up to you about his past and you didn’t want to throw your friendship away all because you had a stupid crush. In saying that though, you still couldn’t help it when butterflies erupt in your stomach at the sound of his voice and you somehow weren’t able to stop your heartbeat from picking up when you catch him smiling at you.


You make your way around the compound looking for Bucky since he was no longer in the living room, for some reason leaving it only half decorated. You find him in the hallway that leads away from the front door Avengers tower.


“Hey there Soldier, you alright?” You ask as you come up behind him and his shoulders tense when he hears your voice.


“I’m fine.” Bucky replies shortly and focuses his attention back onto decorating the walls with colourful streamers.


“I noticed that you only decorated half of the living room. Did something happen?” Your voice is laid with worry as you place a gentle hand on his bicep that is closer to you, which so happens to be his prosthetic one, and he moves his arm away, letting your hand drop back to your side.


Your eyes are filled with worry but he doesn’t look back at you to see the reaction his action had caused.


You were always allowed to touch his metal arm. Never once had he objected or stated that he was uncomfortable, no matter how many times you asked him if he was sure.


You cast your eyes downward, thinking that whatever’s happening with Bucky is your fault and you ignore the aching in your chest as you reach down to grab a streamer to help him put them up.


A tense silence fills the hall as you both work quietly to put up the decorations as soon as possible.


Bucky internally sighs, knowing that it’s his fault as to why there is no conversation flowing between you both. The Winter Soldier keeps sneaking glances at your figure that is standing further up the hall.  He takes in your slouched shoulders and the hair that is acting as a shield around your face. He realises that he hurt you but he begins to feel some regret before it’s clouded over by anger and jealousy at the thought of you laughing and having fun with Sam.


As you both make your way up the hall, Bucky occasionally barking order at you as to where to put the streamers. Tears begin to form in your eyes at the realisation that you might be losing Bucky but you quickly push that idea out of your head. You wouldn’t let that happen. You couldn’t lose Bucky when he was the only thing keeping you here.


When Tony Stark had asked you to join the Avengers you were hesitant as your powers could be used for bad things but you reluctantly agreed once he had pointed out that they could also be used for good. The first few weeks at the compound were long and hard. You had training nearly everyday and you were trying to make friends with your team and you eventually got tired of trying to juggle all these things at once. But then Steve introduced Bucky and you had found a reason to stay. Not only do you have someone in the compound that you could relate to because of your past with HYDRA but you also had made a new friend almost immediately and Bucky made you feel safe and wanted, even on your worst days.


By the time you had both made your way back to the living room, all the decorations were hung up besides a golden banner that read ‘Happy Birthday’ with the number 100 underneath it added by Natasha in neat writing.


“That needs to go high up on the wall!” Wanda instructs as she quickly makes her way past with a bunch of balloons going in her hands as she heads outside the room.


“I’m not going to be able to reach that high. You’re going to need to go on my shoulders.” Bucky says lowly and you mumble an “ok” under your breath as you make your way over to him.


He puts his arms out and you jump onto his back and begin to climb up onto his broad shoulders like you had done many times before when you guys were playing around. Your heart tugs painfully at the memory but you push it away like last time and continue to get the job done.


He hands you the large banner and you hold it in your grasp as he makes his way to the left side of the wall. You let the other side fall from your hands as you hold the banner up to the wall with glue tact stuck to the corners of it.


“Is this high enough?” You snapper and it came out harsher then you attended.


“Put it higher.”


You do as he asks and you bring your arms up further.


“Is this alright your majesty?” You taunt and he growls out a yes as you stick it to the wall before pulling the right side into your hands as he makes his way over in that direction.


“Stretch it out more so it’s smooth.” Bucky grumbles and you do as your told with a roll of your eyes.


Tapping his head gently as a signal to put you down, Bucky lowers you to the floor but not as delicately as usual.


Anger bubbles in your chest as you’ve begin to get fed up with Bucky’s attitude.


“What’s wrong with you?” You say, hurt evident in your voice. “Why are you so moody all of a sudden?”


Guilt begins to wash over Bucky as he realises that he’s hurting you but all that comes out of his mouth is, “It’s your fault.”


“My fault?” You exclaim, your voice raising a few octaves.


“Yes! It’s your fault!” Bucky barks even though he doesn’t mean it. You didn’t do anything wrong, he is jealous.


Suddenly all the lights in the compound switch off and Sam quickly makes his way over to you both.


“Steve’s coming, get into position.” He whispers and you nod in understanding quickly ducking behind the couch with Bucky  in the middle of you and Sam.


Footsteps begin to get closer to the living room but you refuse to let go of your argument with Bucky. “I didn’t even do anything wrong.” You quietly hiss in his direction and he practically hear him rolling his eyes as he clamps his metal hand over your mouth.


“Keep your mouth shut and we won’t get caught.”


“Just make her shut up.” Sam interrupts and before you know what’s happening, Bucky is being pushed towards you.


Your lips collide with his and it’s like gasoline and vodka have finally met a lit match, creating an explosion of emotions erupt in your stomach. You’re both frozen for a second before he gently brings his metal hand up to cup your cheek. The cold metal brings your brain back to its senses and you begin to respond, slowly kissing Bucky back. The kiss in gentle and sweet and when you finally pull away from each other you’re out breath and staring at him with wide eyes.


“But— you— I thought—“ Your rambling was cut off when the lights were switched on and a bunch of bodies moved around you to jump up.


“Surprise!” Everyone screams to Steve and you can hear his laugh enter the room as you slowly get up, mumbling a weak “surprise”.


“Happy birthday Steve!” You giggle, momentarily forgetting what happened with Bucky, and give him a kiss on the cheek as he comes forward and wraps his arms around you in a bear hug.


“Thanks sweetheart.” He kisses your forehead before moving on to other people as they congratulate him.


“Can I talk to you for a second?” Bucky asks as he comes to stand beside you after sharing a hug with Steve and cracking a few jokes about his old age.


“Sure.” You mumble, blushing as you remember the kiss you had shared with the soldier moments before.


His hand gently incloses around your forearm as he brings you outside into the hallway.


“I know I was a dickhead.” He begins and you snort, “I hope you’re not expecting me to deny that.”


“I’m not.” He replies as a smile begins to tug at his lips before he continues on. “It’s just that when I saw you and Sam together I was really jealous because you might like him— which is ok if you like him you don’t need to like me— but I just got upset and acted out and I—“


You fist Bucky shirt and for a moment he looks scared, thinking you’re going to punch him, before you pull him towards you, capturing his lips in a kiss before ending it just as quickly at it began.


“Wow.” He mumbles and your cheeks turn pink.


“I like you, you idiot.” You admit quietly. Bucky’s eyes light up and a grin spreads across his face, making butterflies erupt in your stomach once more.


“I like you too, Doll.” He admits, “I like you a whole dam lot.”

Prompt:

Keep your mouth shut and we won’t get caught.


Summary:

Bucky is head over heels for Y/N and she feels the same but both are oblivious to the others feelings and when the tension because to much for the other Avengers, Sam and Wanda decide to form a plan to make Bucky jealous. With a bit of a push from Sam, Bucky may just admit his feelings for Y/N on the night of Steve’s surprise birthday party.


Warnings:

Some swearing, a bit of angst

2,662


A/N:

hey guys this is the second part of @bucketbarneslove writing challenge! i’m super sorry that this took so long to complete and finally get up but i’ve been travelling overseas and haven’t had a lot of time to write and for some reason my tumblr keeps stuffing up so its getting kind of frustrating to post this but i’ve finally got everything done and so here’s the second part to the story. hope you guys enjoy!

“We need to get a start on things.” A gruff voice disturbs the silence of the room, waking Sam up and making you as well as the other Avengers turn their heads to Bucky who just entered the room. “He’s right.” Tony speaks up, “If we don’t start now then we won’t have things ready in time for when Cap comes home.”


Wanda and Vision pack up their board game while Tony gets FRIDAY to get the rest of the Avengers into the room.


“I call dibs on making the cake!” Natasha shouts from the hall before entering the room and coming to stand besides you as you get off the couch. Various people pipe up and chose what they’re gonna do to help out before Sam quickly cuts in, “Y/A and I will help Tash bake.” He pipes up and Natasha protests but Tony quickly cuts in, saying that it would be for the best and he doesn’t want her burning the kitchen down before the party starts.


“Okay but that implies that I can burn it down after the party.” Natasha sass’ back and Tony rolls his eyes and doesn’t respond.


Wanda and Vision leave to go blow up balloons, Peter Parker follow Tony down to the garage so they can go buy some party foods as well as chocolate and lollies and before you know it the only people left in the room are Natasha, Sam, Bucky and yourself.


An awkward silence settles across the room for a brief moment as we stare at the enormous pile of decorations that Bucky needs to put up around the compound.


Sam puts an arm around your shoulder and passes Bucky, giving him a pat on the back.


“Good luck mate.” He says as he leads you to the kitchen and you quickly send Bucky a sympathetic smile which is returned with a forced one before he casts his eyes downwards.


“Lets get started on this cake.” Natasha says and gathers all the ingredients and materials to make a vanilla cake.


“Chocolate cake is better.” Sam states, looking over my shoulder as I begin to put the cake mix in the bowl.


I gasp tip the rest of the mix into the bowl before turning around and hitting his chest.


“Ouch! What was that for?!” He explains, taken aback by your sudden change of attitude.


“Vanilla cake is the best flavour cake.” You argue, crossing your arms across your chest to prove that he won’t be able to persuade you.


Your bickering continues for a solid five minutes before Sam is chasing you around the kitchen with flour on his hands and you laugh as you dodge him and duck behind the table.


“You may be faster then me but I’m smaller.” You mumble under your breath as you quietly crawl under the table using only your knees to move forward, while both your hands are holding piles of flour.


“You’re gonna have to get up from behind that table eventually Y/N.” Sam says in a sing-song voice and you whistle to get his attention, making him look down with a puzzled look before you quickly throw one hand of flour up into his face.


He coughs as his stumbles back and makes a noise which sounds like a bird crossed between a seal. You snicker as you get out from under the table and flour falls around because Sam has dropped his pile of flower in shock. You make your way behind Sam as he is still trying to get flour off his face and out of your hair.


You throw your last pile of flour at the back of Sams head and he whips around to face you. “Oh you’re gonna regret that.” He threats, trying to sound intimidating but the smile forming on his face is a clear indicator that he doesn’t totally mean it.


You turn to run out of the kitchen but Sam lunges forward and wraps his arms around your stomach, picking you up and you let out a squeal of surprise as you feel your self being lift up into the air.


“Let me go.” You screech as you burst into a fit of giggles as he begins to tickle your stomach as he places your feet back of the floor.


“P-please stop! I’m go-gonna die!” You try to get out and he laughs at your expense. “Not until you admit that chocolate cake is better!” He sung. “Ok ok! Chocolate cake is better!” You let out reluctantly.


His fingers stop attacking your sides and he lets you slump down onto the kitchen floor as you wheeze trying to catch your breath. “You are the… worst…. person… ever.” You manage to get out between taking big gulps of air. “I know.” Sam chuckles, moving away from you and standing next to Natasha who was watching the whole scene play out in front of her with an amused expression.


“Well while you two were having your little fight over there I finished the cake and put it in the oven.” Natasha informs and your eyes drift over to the oven from your viewpoint on the floor and you could see that she did in fact have the cake in the oven.


“Ok well now that it’s done I’m gonna go.” Sam begins to walk towards the kitchen door and Natasha calls him back.


“No I don’t think so Bird Boy. You’re going to stay here and clean up this mess while I prepare the icing.” Natasha chimes and Sam begins to protest but stops the minute she shoots him a glare and instead he begins to mumbles profanities under his breath as he goes to get the vacuum.


You let out a giggle as you pick yourself up from the floor and dust off your body to make sure there is no flour on you.


“You need my help with anything Nat? Maybe with the 100 candles that you’re going to have to put on that cake?” You question and she shakes her head.


“No I’ll be ok. Go find your man Bucky and help him put up all those decorations.” Natasha winks and you let out a squeak, afraid that someone might of heard her.


“He’s not my man.” You protest weakly and she rolls her eyes.


“Maybe so but you know you want him to be.”


You ignore her comment as you exit the room. Natasha was right. You did want bucky to be “your Man” but it’s not like you would ever admit that to him though. It had taken a while for you to gain Bucky’s trust and for him to open up to you about his past and you didn’t want to throw your friendship away all because you had a stupid crush. In saying that though, you still couldn’t help it when butterflies erupt in your stomach at the sound of his voice and you somehow weren’t able to stop your heartbeat from picking up when you catch him smiling at you.


You make your way around the compound looking for Bucky since he was no longer in the living room, for some reason leaving it only half decorated. You find him in the hallway that leads away from the front door Avengers tower.


“Hey there Soldier, you alright?” You ask as you come up behind him and his shoulders tense when he hears your voice.


“I’m fine.” Bucky replies shortly and focuses his attention back onto decorating the walls with colourful streamers.


“I noticed that you only decorated half of the living room. Did something happen?” Your voice is laid with worry as you place a gentle hand on his bicep that is closer to you, which so happens to be his prosthetic one, and he moves his arm away, letting your hand drop back to your side.


Your eyes are filled with worry but he doesn’t look back at you to see the reaction his action had caused.


You were always allowed to touch his metal arm. Never once had he objected or stated that he was uncomfortable, no matter how many times you asked him if he was sure.


You cast your eyes downward, thinking that whatever’s happening with Bucky is your fault and you ignore the aching in your chest as you reach down to grab a streamer to help him put them up.


A tense silence fills the hall as you both work quietly to put up the decorations as soon as possible.


Bucky internally sighs, knowing that it’s his fault as to why there is no conversation flowing between you both. The Winter Soldier keeps sneaking glances at your figure that is standing further up the hall.  He takes in your slouched shoulders and the hair that is acting as a shield around your face. He realises that he hurt you but he begins to feel some regret before it’s clouded over by anger and jealousy at the thought of you laughing and having fun with Sam.


As you both make your way up the hall, Bucky occasionally barking order at you as to where to put the streamers. Tears begin to form in your eyes at the realisation that you might be losing Bucky but you quickly push that idea out of your head. You wouldn’t let that happen. You couldn’t lose Bucky when he was the only thing keeping you here.


When Tony Stark had asked you to join the Avengers you were hesitant as your powers could be used for bad things but you reluctantly agreed once he had pointed out that they could also be used for good. The first few weeks at the compound were long and hard. You had training nearly everyday and you were trying to make friends with your team and you eventually got tired of trying to juggle all these things at once. But then Steve introduced Bucky and you had found a reason to stay. Not only do you have someone in the compound that you could relate to because of your past with HYDRA but you also had made a new friend almost immediately and Bucky made you feel safe and wanted, even on your worst days.


By the time you had both made your way back to the living room, all the decorations were hung up besides a golden banner that read ‘Happy Birthday’ with the number 100 underneath it added by Natasha in neat writing.


“That needs to go high up on the wall!” Wanda instructs as she quickly makes her way past with a bunch of balloons going in her hands as she heads outside the room.


“I’m not going to be able to reach that high. You’re going to need to go on my shoulders.” Bucky says lowly and you mumble an “ok” under your breath as you make your way over to him.


He puts his arms out and you jump onto his back and begin to climb up onto his broad shoulders like you had done many times before when you guys were playing around. Your heart tugs painfully at the memory but you push it away like last time and continue to get the job done.


He hands you the large banner and you hold it in your grasp as he makes his way to the left side of the wall. You let the other side fall from your hands as you hold the banner up to the wall with glue tact stuck to the corners of it.


“Is this high enough?” You snapper and it came out harsher then you attended.


“Put it higher.”


You do as he asks and you bring your arms up further.


“Is this alright your majesty?” You taunt and he growls out a yes as you stick it to the wall before pulling the right side into your hands as he makes his way over in that direction.


“Stretch it out more so it’s smooth.” Bucky grumbles and you do as your told with a roll of your eyes.


Tapping his head gently as a signal to put you down, Bucky lowers you to the floor but not as delicately as usual.


Anger bubbles in your chest as you’ve begin to get fed up with Bucky’s attitude.


“What’s wrong with you?” You say, hurt evident in your voice. “Why are you so moody all of a sudden?”


Guilt begins to wash over Bucky as he realises that he’s hurting you but all that comes out of his mouth is, “It’s your fault.”


“My fault?” You exclaim, your voice raising a few octaves.


“Yes! It’s your fault!” Bucky barks even though he doesn’t mean it. You didn’t do anything wrong, he is jealous.


Suddenly all the lights in the compound switch off and Sam quickly makes his way over to you both.


“Steve’s coming, get into position.” He whispers and you nod in understanding quickly ducking behind the couch with Bucky  in the middle of you and Sam.


Footsteps begin to get closer to the living room but you refuse to let go of your argument with Bucky. “I didn’t even do anything wrong.” You quietly hiss in his direction and he practically hear him rolling his eyes as he clamps his metal hand over your mouth.


“Keep your mouth shut and we won’t get caught.”


“Just make her shut up.” Sam interrupts and before you know what’s happening, Bucky is being pushed towards you.


Your lips collide with his and it’s like gasoline and vodka have finally met a lit match, creating an explosion of emotions erupt in your stomach. You’re both frozen for a second before he gently brings his metal hand up to cup your cheek. The cold metal brings your brain back to its senses and you begin to respond, slowly kissing Bucky back. The kiss in gentle and sweet and when you finally pull away from each other you’re out breath and staring at him with wide eyes.


“But— you— I thought—“ Your rambling was cut off when the lights were switched on and a bunch of bodies moved around you to jump up.


“Surprise!” Everyone screams to Steve and you can hear his laugh enter the room as you slowly get up, mumbling a weak “surprise”.


“Happy birthday Steve!” You giggle, momentarily forgetting what happened with Bucky, and give him a kiss on the cheek as he comes forward and wraps his arms around you in a bear hug.


“Thanks sweetheart.” He kisses your forehead before moving on to other people as they congratulate him.


“Can I talk to you for a second?” Bucky asks as he comes to stand beside you after sharing a hug with Steve and cracking a few jokes about his old age.


“Sure.” You mumble, blushing as you remember the kiss you had shared with the soldier moments before.


His hand gently incloses around your forearm as he brings you outside into the hallway.


“I know I was a dickhead.” He begins and you snort, “I hope you’re not expecting me to deny that.”


“I’m not.” He replies as a smile begins to tug at his lips before he continues on. “It’s just that when I saw you and Sam together I was really jealous because you might like him— which is ok if you like him you don’t need to like me— but I just got upset and acted out and I—“


You fist Bucky shirt and for a moment he looks scared, thinking you’re going to punch him, before you pull him towards you, capturing his lips in a kiss before ending it just as quickly at it began.


“Wow.” He mumbles and your cheeks turn pink.


“I like you, you idiot.” You admit quietly. Bucky’s eyes light up and a grin spreads across his face, making butterflies erupt in your stomach once more.


“I like you too, Doll.” He admits, “I like you a whole dam lot.”
