“Good luck mate.” He says as he leads you to the kitchen and you quickly send Bucky a sympathetic smile which is returned with a forced one before he casts his eyes downwards.


“Lets get started on this cake.” Natasha says and gathers all the ingredients and materials to make a vanilla cake.


“Chocolate cake is better.” Sam states, looking over my shoulder as I begin to put the cake mix in the bowl.


I gasp tip the rest of the mix into the bowl before turning around and hitting his chest.


“Ouch! What was that for?!” He explains, taken aback by your sudden change of attitude.


“Vanilla cake is the best flavour cake.” You argue, crossing your arms across your chest to prove that he won’t be able to persuade you.


Your bickering continues for a solid five minutes before Sam is chasing you around the kitchen with flour on his hands and you laugh as you dodge him and duck behind the table.


“You may be faster then me but I’m smaller.” You mumble under your breath as you quietly crawl under the table using only your knees to move forward, while both your hands are holding piles of flour.


“You’re gonna have to get up from behind that table eventually Y/N.” Sam says in a sing-song voice and you whistle to get his attention, making him look down with a puzzled look before you quickly throw one hand of flour up into his face.


He coughs as his stumbles back and makes a noise which sounds like a bird crossed between a seal. You snicker as you get out from under the table and flour falls around because Sam has dropped his pile of flower in shock. You make your way behind Sam as he is still trying to get flour off his face and out of your hair.


You throw your last pile of flour at the back of Sams head and he whips around to face you. “Oh you’re gonna regret that.” He threats, trying to sound intimidating but the smile forming on his face is a clear indicator that he doesn’t totally mean it.


You turn to run out of the kitchen but Sam lunges forward and wraps his arms around your stomach, picking you up and you let out a squeal of surprise as you feel your self being lift up into the air.


“Let me go.” You screech as you burst into a fit of giggles as he begins to tickle your stomach as he places your feet back of the floor.


“P-please stop! I’m go-gonna die!” You try to get out and he laughs at your expense. “Not until you admit that chocolate cake is better!” He sung. “Ok ok! Chocolate cake is better!” You let out reluctantly.


His fingers stop attacking your sides and he lets you slump down onto the kitchen floor as you wheeze trying to catch your breath. “You are the… worst…. person… ever.” You manage to get out between taking big gulps of air. “I know.” Sam chuckles, moving away from you and standing next to Natasha who was watching the whole scene play out in front of her with an amused expression.


“Well while you two were having your little fight over there I finished the cake and put it in the oven.” Natasha informs and your eyes drift over to the oven from your viewpoint on the floor and you could see that she did in fact have the cake in the oven.


“Ok well now that it’s done I’m gonna go.” Sam begins to walk towards the kitchen door and Natasha calls him back.


“No I don’t think so Bird Boy. You’re going to stay here and clean up this mess while I prepare the icing.” Natasha chimes and Sam begins to protest but stops the minute she shoots him a glare and instead he begins to mumbles profanities under his breath as he goes to get the vacuum.


You let out a giggle as you pick yourself up from the floor and dust off your body to make sure there is no flour on you.


“You need my help with anything Nat? Maybe with the 100 candles that you’re going to have to put on that cake?” You question and she shakes her head.


“No I’ll be ok. Go find your man Bucky and help him put up all those decorations.” Natasha winks and you let out a squeak, afraid that someone might of heard her.


“He’s not my man.” You protest weakly and she rolls her eyes.


“Maybe so but you know you want him to be.”


You ignore her comment as you exit the room. Natasha was right. You did want bucky to be “your Man” but it’s not like you would ever admit that to him though. It had taken a while for you to gain Bucky’s trust and for him to open up to you about his past and you didn’t want to throw your friendship away all because you had a stupid crush. In saying that though, you still couldn’t help it when butterflies erupt in your stomach at the sound of his voice and you somehow weren’t able to stop your heartbeat from picking up when you catch him smiling at you.


You make your way around the compound looking for Bucky since he was no longer in the living room, for some reason leaving it only half decorated. You find him in the hallway that leads away from the front door Avengers tower.


“Hey there Soldier, you alright?” You ask as you come up behind him and his shoulders tense when he hears your voice.


“I’m fine.” Bucky replies shortly and focuses his attention back onto decorating the walls with colourful streamers.


“I noticed that you only decorated half of the living room. Did something happen?” Your voice is laid with worry as you place a gentle hand on his bicep that is closer to you, which so happens to be his prosthetic one, and he moves his arm away, letting your hand drop back to your side.


Your eyes are filled with worry but he doesn’t look back at you to see the reaction his action had caused.


You were always allowed to touch his metal arm. Never once had he objected or stated that he was uncomfortable, no matter how many times you asked him if he was sure.


You cast your eyes downward, thinking that whatever’s happening with Bucky is your fault and you ignore the aching in your chest as you reach down to grab a streamer to help him put them up.


A tense silence fills the hall as you both work quietly to put up the decorations as soon as possible.


Bucky internally sighs, knowing that it’s his fault as to why there is no conversation flowing between you both. The Winter Soldier keeps sneaking glances at your figure that is standing further up the hall.  He takes in your slouched shoulders and the hair that is acting as a shield around your face. He realises that he hurt you but he begins to feel some regret before it’s clouded over by anger and jealousy at the thought of you laughing and having fun with Sam.


As you both make your way up the hall, Bucky occasionally barking order at you as to where to put the streamers. Tears begin to form in your eyes at the realisation that you might be losing Bucky but you quickly push that idea out of your head. You wouldn’t let that happen. You couldn’t lose Bucky when he was the only thing keeping you here.


When Tony Stark had asked you to join the Avengers you were hesitant as your powers could be used for bad things but you reluctantly agreed once he had pointed out that they could also be used for good. The first few weeks at the compound were long and hard. You had training nearly everyday and you were trying to make friends with your team and you eventually got tired of trying to juggle all these things at once. But then Steve introduced Bucky and you had found a reason to stay. Not only do you have someone in the compound that you could relate to because of your past with HYDRA but you also had made a new friend almost immediately and Bucky made you feel safe and wanted, even on your worst days.


By the time you had both made your way back to the living room, all the decorations were hung up besides a golden banner that read ‘Happy Birthday’ with the number 100 underneath it added by Natasha in neat writing.


“That needs to go high up on the wall!” Wanda instructs as she quickly makes her way past with a bunch of balloons going in her hands as she heads outside the room.


“I’m not going to be able to reach that high. You’re going to need to go on my shoulders.” Bucky says lowly and you mumble an “ok” under your breath as you make your way over to him.


He puts his arms out and you jump onto his back and begin to climb up onto his broad shoulders like you had done many times before when you guys were playing around. Your heart tugs painfully at the memory but you push it away like last time and continue to get the job done.


He hands you the large banner and you hold it in your grasp as he makes his way to the left side of the wall. You let the other side fall from your hands as you hold the banner up to the wall with glue tact stuck to the corners of it.


“Is this high enough?” You snapper and it came out harsher then you attended.


“Put it higher.”


You do as he asks and you bring your arms up further.


“Is this alright your majesty?” You taunt and he growls out a yes as you stick it to the wall before pulling the right side into your hands as he makes his way over in that direction.


“Stretch it out more so it’s smooth.” Bucky grumbles and you do as your told with a roll of your eyes.


Tapping his head gently as a signal to put you down, Bucky lowers you to the floor but not as delicately as usual.


Anger bubbles in your chest as you’ve begin to get fed up with Bucky’s attitude.


“What’s wrong with you?” You say, hurt evident in your voice. “Why are you so moody all of a sudden?”


Guilt begins to wash over Bucky as he realises that he’s hurting you but all that comes out of his mouth is, “It’s your fault.”


“My fault?” You exclaim, your voice raising a few octaves.


“Yes! It’s your fault!” Bucky barks even though he doesn’t mean it. You didn’t do anything wrong, he is jealous.


Suddenly all the lights in the compound switch off and Sam quickly makes his way over to you both.


“Steve’s coming, get into position.” He whispers and you nod in understanding quickly ducking behind the couch with Bucky  in the middle of you and Sam.


Footsteps begin to get closer to the living room but you refuse to let go of your argument with Bucky. “I didn’t even do anything wrong.” You quietly hiss in his direction and he practically hear him rolling his eyes as he clamps his metal hand over your mouth.


“Keep your mouth shut and we won’t get caught.”


“Just make her shut up.” Sam interrupts and before you know what’s happening, Bucky is being pushed towards you.


Your lips collide with his and it’s like gasoline and vodka have finally met a lit match, creating an explosion of emotions erupt in your stomach. You’re both frozen for a second before he gently brings his metal hand up to cup your cheek. The cold metal brings your brain back to its senses and you begin to respond, slowly kissing Bucky back. The kiss in gentle and sweet and when you finally pull away from each other you’re out breath and staring at him with wide eyes.


“But— you— I thought—“ Your rambling was cut off when the lights were switched on and a bunch of bodies moved around you to jump up.


“Surprise!” Everyone screams to Steve and you can hear his laugh enter the room as you slowly get up, mumbling a weak “surprise”.


“Happy birthday Steve!” You giggle, momentarily forgetting what happened with Bucky, and give him a kiss on the cheek as he comes forward and wraps his arms around you in a bear hug.


“Thanks sweetheart.” He kisses your forehead before moving on to other people as they congratulate him.


“Can I talk to you for a second?” Bucky asks as he comes to stand beside you after sharing a hug with Steve and cracking a few jokes about his old age.


“Sure.” You mumble, blushing as you remember the kiss you had shared with the soldier moments before.


His hand gently incloses around your forearm as he brings you outside into the hallway.


“I know I was a dickhead.” He begins and you snort, “I hope you’re not expecting me to deny that.”


“I’m not.” He replies as a smile begins to tug at his lips before he continues on. “It’s just that when I saw you and Sam together I was really jealous because you might like him— which is ok if you like him you don’t need to like me— but I just got upset and acted out and I—“


You fist Bucky shirt and for a moment he looks scared, thinking you’re going to punch him, before you pull him towards you, capturing his lips in a kiss before ending it just as quickly at it began.


“Wow.” He mumbles and your cheeks turn pink.


“I like you, you idiot.” You admit quietly. Bucky’s eyes light up and a grin spreads across his face, making butterflies erupt in your stomach once more.


“I like you too, Doll.” He admits, “I like you a whole dam lot.”
trail.content_abstract:
Part 1 | Part 2

Prompt:

Keep your mouth shut and we won’t get caught.


Summary:

Bucky is head over heels for Y/N and she feels the same but both are oblivious to the others feelings and when the tension because to much for the other Avengers, Sam and Wanda decide to form a plan to make Bucky jealous. With a bit of a push from Sam, Bucky may just admit his feelings for Y/N on the night of Steve’s surprise birthday party.


Warnings:

Some swearing, a bit of angst


Word count:

2,662


A/N:

hey guys this is the second part of @bucketbarneslove writing challenge! i’m super sorry that this took so long to complete and finally get up but i’ve been travelling overseas and haven’t had a lot of time to write and for some reason my tumblr keeps stuffing up so its getting kind of frustrating to post this but i’ve finally got everything done and so here’s the second part to the story. hope you guys enjoy!
